div.span: While Jarrell ISD schools are closed, the district is offering these enrollment instructions for new students.

span.style: font-size: 11pt; background-color: transparent; font-variant-numeric: normal; font-variant-east-asian: normal; vertical-align: baseline; white-space: pre-wrap; font-family: Arial; color: rgb(191, 191, 191);

p.span: Jarrell ISD is located in northern Williamson County. The mascot is The Cougars. It has four campuses: Jarrell High School, Jarrell Middle School, Igo Elementary School and Jarrell Elementary. The district is home to more than 2,060 students and is expected to average 9.4 percent growth for the next 10 years. JISD is led by Superintendent Dr. William Chapman.

a.title: Free Meals Service Moving to 3 Days a Week

div.div: Free Meals Service Moving to 3 Days a Week

div.p: Free Grab-and-Go Meals will be provided 3 days a week (Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays) starting Monday, April 27. read more

a.title: Jarrell ISD is Celebrating Excellent Educators

div.div: Jarrell ISD is Celebrating Excellent Educators

div.p: Jarrell ISD is celebrating excellent educators through its annual Teacher-of-the-Year and Paraprofessional-of-the-Year recognition program. read more

a.title: JISD Schools to Stay Closed for the Remainder of 2019-20 School Year

div.div: JISD Schools to Stay Closed for the Remainder of 2019-20 School Year

div.p: Jarrell ISD, in cooperation with the Texas Education Agency, is promoting the "Stay Well, Texas" public health campaign to remind students, parents and staff members of the steps we can take to stay healthy during the COVID-19 pan...read more
Jarrell ISD is reminding families the importance of participating in the 2020 Census, which is now underway.read more
